instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
threads.message:
Hi, got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 machine that boots up (cap lock has green light, keyboard has backlight and the machine has sound). The display has backlight but no image. 

SCM and PRAM reset did nothing. It also doesn't seem to detect external monitor. Board is intact and LCD cable seems undamaged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
threads.message:
Force external video disconnecting internal LCD.

Any history available?
Did you check diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>EDP_INT</SIGNAL> data lines?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
threads.message:
Disconnected LCD but still not detecting external monitor. 

Client says one day he turned it on and it had no image. 

Mode to ground on <SIGNAL>DP_INT</SIGNAL> lines is over 0.250 on all of them

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
threads.message:
Do you get almost same value on each pair???
You may get difference between pairs, but should get almost same reading for both lines of a pair.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
threads.message: Yes, i get almost same value between all of them. from 0.258 to  0.262

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02
threads.message: Then must be bad CPU; damaged iGPU...
